intro: Enicosanthum fuscum, commonly known as the black sandflower, is a rare and intriguing member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dark, almost black, bracts that resemble small flowers, giving it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with a yellowish or pale green color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Enicosanthum fuscum is considered a rare and endangered species.
